info.name: Al-Hamra Brokerage API v2
info.description:
Comprehensive Postman collection for the Al-Hamra Brokerage Management System API. Covers authentication, catalog (categories, products, services), sales operations, stock management, reporting and document uploads for the v2 REST interface.

Version 2 highlights new installment CRUD endpoints for managing payment schedules.

request.description: Creates a customer record with the extended profile fields. Creator metadata is stored automatically based on the authenticated user.
Returns the full customer profile including creator metadata (`added_by_role`, `added_by_branch_id`, `added_by_agent_id`).
Admin or Branch Admin entries must keep agent_id null. Only authenticated agents get their own agent_id assigned automatically.

Record a payment against a sales order. Development commissions now remain in a pending state until the month-end processing job runs (php artisan commissions:process), so no commission records are created at payment time.

Retrieve paginated payment history with flexible filters across customer, agent, branch and sales order metadata. Enable the optional export or print flags to download CSV output or consume a print-friendly JSON payload.

item.name: Installments
item.description: CRUD endpoints for managing customer installments.

request.description: Summarize commission totals with gap logic distribution. The response separates paid amounts from pending potential commissions calculated from payments that have not yet been processed.
Detailed commission ledger including agent, employee and branch filters. Use export=excel for CSV downloads or print=1 for a print-friendly payload.
Comprehensive sales order report with customer, agent and branch context. Supports CSV export and print-friendly formats.
Aggregated employee sales performance including order counts, sales totals and collection ratios. Supports filtering by branch, sales type, and date range while allowing sort by any metric.
Current stock position with category filters and CSV/print options for offline analysis.
Ledger view of income accounts. Apply account filters or export results for financial reconciliation.
Customer-specific ledger with running balance. Requires a valid customer_id.
Supplier ledger driven by entries tagged with supplier meta information.
Account-specific statement view supporting either account_id or account_code filters.
